meanings.def: happening or coming before all other similar things or people; 1st
examples: her first husband
the first turning on the right
I didn't take the first bus.
It was the first time they had ever met.
It's always exciting to visit a country for the first time.
students in their first year at college
First impressions can be misleading.
She resolved to do it at the first (= earliest) opportunity.
King Edward I (= pronounced ‘King Edward the First’)
the first of May/May 1st
His second book is better than his first.
If he wants to see me, he should make the first move.
Local voters gave Steven Hughes first preference.
My first impulse was to run away.
We're having chicken for the first course.
When the first settlers moved into the area they faced immense hardship.
You can have first choice of all the rooms.

meanings.def: the most important or best
examples: Your first duty is to your family.
She won first prize in the competition.
an issue of the first importance

meanings.def: before anyone or anything else; at the beginning
examples: ‘Do you want a drink?’ ‘I'll finish my work first.’
First I had to decide what to wear.
Who came first in the race (= who won)?
It plunged nose first into the river.
After the war, Erica went on to marry first one American millionaire and then another.

meanings.def: for the first time
examples: When did you first meet him?
The book was first published in 1971.
The image has haunted me ever since I first saw it.
I first discovered the cello when I was four and a half.
If there's anything really exciting, you'll hear it here first.

meanings.def: used to introduce the first of a list of points you want to make in a speech or piece of writing
examples: This method has two advantages: first it is cheaper and second it is quicker.
First, however, I would like to thank the folks at the Center for Financial Education for inviting me to speak today.

This study has the following aims: first, to investigate how international students in the UK use humour; second, to examine how jokes can help to establish social relationships; and third, to explore the role that humour plays in helping overseas students adjust to life in the UK.
Let us begin by identifying some of the popular joke genres in the UK.
Next, let us turn to/Next, let us consider the question of gender differences in the use of humour.
Finally/Lastly, let us briefly examine the role of humour in defining a nation’s culture.
This diagram illustrates the process of paper-making./This diagram shows how paper is made.
First/First of all, logs are delivered to a paper mill, where the bark is removed and the wood is cut into small chips.
Next/Second, the wood chips are pulped, either using chemicals or in a pulping machine.
Pulping breaks down the internal structure of the wood and enables/allows the natural oils to be removed.
Once/After the wood has been pulped, the pulp is bleached in order to remove impurities. /…is bleached so that impurities can be removed.
The next stage is to feed the pulp into the paper machine, where it is mixed with water and then poured onto a wire conveyor belt.
As the pulp travels along the conveyor belt, the water drains away. This causes the solid material to sink to the bottom, forming a layer of paper.
At this point the new paper is still wet, so it is passed between large heated rollers, which press out the remaining water and simultaneously dry the paper/…dry the paper at the same time.
The final stage is to wind the paper onto large rolls./Finally, the paper is wound onto large rolls.

meanings.def: used to emphasize that you are determined not to do something
examples: She swore that she wouldn't apologize—she'd die first!

meanings.def: at or in the beginning
examples: I didn't like the job much at first.
At first I thought he was shy, but then I discovered he was just not interested in other people.
(saying) If at first you don't succeed, try, try again.
The brochure is divided into two sections, dealing firstly with basic courses and secondly with advanced ones.
Maggie had seen him nearly every day at first. Now she saw him much less.

meanings.def: to be considered more important than anything else
examples: In any decision she makes, her family always comes first.

meanings.def: with your feet touching the ground before any other part of your body
examples: He landed feet first.

meanings.def: if you leave a place feet first, you are carried out after you are dead
examples: You'll have to carry me out feet first!

meanings.def: more than anything else
examples: He does a little teaching, but first and foremost he's a writer.

meanings.def: in every way that is important; completely
examples: She regarded herself, first and last, as a musician.

meanings.def: people will be dealt with, seen, etc. strictly in the order in which they arrive
examples: Tickets are available on a first come, first served basis.

meanings.def: before doing anything else; at the beginning
examples: First of all, let me ask you something.
This diagram illustrates the process of paper-making./This diagram shows how paper is made.
First/First of all, logs are delivered to a paper mill, where the bark is removed and the wood is cut into small chips.
Next/Second, the wood chips are pulped, either using chemicals or in a pulping machine.
Pulping breaks down the internal structure of the wood and enables/allows the natural oils to be removed.
Once/After the wood has been pulped, the pulp is bleached in order to remove impurities. /…is bleached so that impurities can be removed.
The next stage is to feed the pulp into the paper machine, where it is mixed with water and then poured onto a wire conveyor belt.
As the pulp travels along the conveyor belt, the water drains away. This causes the solid material to sink to the bottom, forming a layer of paper.
At this point the new paper is still wet, so it is passed between large heated rollers, which press out the remaining water and simultaneously dry the paper/…dry the paper at the same time.
The final stage is to wind the paper onto large rolls./Finally, the paper is wound onto large rolls.

meanings.def: as the most important thing
examples: The content of any article needs, first of all, to be relevant to the reader.

meanings.def: before anything else
examples: First off, let's see how much it'll cost.

meanings.def: to start with; before anything else
examples: First up is a report on the situation in Australia.

meanings.def: moving forwards or downwards with your head in front of the rest of your body
examples: He fell head first down the stairs.

meanings.def: without thinking carefully about something before acting
examples: She got divorced and rushed head first into another marriage.

meanings.def: to consider somebody/something to be more important than anyone/anything else
examples: She always puts her children first.

meanings.def: safety is the most important thing
examples: When cycling on the roads, remember: safety first.
I didn't like the job much at first.
At first I thought he was shy, but then I discovered he was just not interested in other people.
(saying) If at first you don't succeed, try, try again.
The brochure is divided into two sections, dealing firstly with basic courses and secondly with advanced ones.
Maggie had seen him nearly every day at first. Now she saw him much less.

idioms.def: to be considered more important than anything else
examples: In any decision she makes, her family always comes first.

idioms.def: with your feet touching the ground before any other part of your body
examples: He landed feet first.
You'll have to carry me out feet first!
He does a little teaching, but first and foremost he's a writer.

idioms.def: in every way that is important; completely
examples: She regarded herself, first and last, as a musician.

idioms.def: people will be dealt with, seen, etc. strictly in the order in which they arrive
examples: Tickets are available on a first come, first served basis.

idioms.def: before doing anything else; at the beginning
examples: First of all, let me ask you something.
This diagram illustrates the process of paper-making./This diagram shows how paper is made.
First/First of all, logs are delivered to a paper mill, where the bark is removed and the wood is cut into small chips.
Next/Second, the wood chips are pulped, either using chemicals or in a pulping machine.
Pulping breaks down the internal structure of the wood and enables/allows the natural oils to be removed.
Once/After the wood has been pulped, the pulp is bleached in order to remove impurities. /…is bleached so that impurities can be removed.
The next stage is to feed the pulp into the paper machine, where it is mixed with water and then poured onto a wire conveyor belt.
As the pulp travels along the conveyor belt, the water drains away. This causes the solid material to sink to the bottom, forming a layer of paper.
At this point the new paper is still wet, so it is passed between large heated rollers, which press out the remaining water and simultaneously dry the paper/…dry the paper at the same time.
The final stage is to wind the paper onto large rolls./Finally, the paper is wound onto large rolls.
The content of any article needs, first of all, to be relevant to the reader.
The brochure is divided into two sections, dealing firstly with basic courses and secondly with advanced ones.
Maggie had seen him nearly every day at first. Now she saw him much less.
First off, let's see how much it'll cost.

idioms.def: to start with; before anything else
examples: First up is a report on the situation in Australia.

idioms.def: moving forwards or downwards with your head in front of the rest of your body
examples: He fell head first down the stairs.
She got divorced and rushed head first into another marriage.

idioms.def: to consider somebody/something to be more important than anyone/anything else
examples: She always puts her children first.

idioms.def: safety is the most important thing
examples: When cycling on the roads, remember: safety first.

meanings.def: the person or thing that comes or happens before all other similar people or things
examples: I was the first in my family to go to college.
Sheila and Jim were the first to arrive.

meanings.def: the earliest
examples: The first I heard about the wedding (= the first time I became aware of it) was when I saw it in the local paper.
The first I knew of a problem was around 9.30 a.m. last Monday.

meanings.def: the most likely
examples: I'd be the first to admit (= I will most willingly admit) I might be wrong.
The poorest will be the first to suffer.
Nurses are often the first to say they feel underappreciated.

meanings.def: an important achievement, event, etc., never done or experienced before
examples: We went on a cruise, a first for both of us.
This meeting between the two presidents is a historic first.

meanings.def: the lowest gear on a car, bicycle, etc. that you use when you are moving slowly
examples: in first He stuck the car in first and revved.
It's very difficult to find first on this car.
Put the car into first and crept forward slowly.
She engaged first gear and pulled off.
As he moved into first the gear-lever knob came off in his hand.

meanings.def: the highest level of university degree at British universities
examples: She got a first in maths at Exeter.
He did Philosophy and English Literature and got a double first.

meanings.def: the person or thing with the highest status in a group
examples: He was regarded as the ‘first among equals’ by the other office clerks.

meanings.def: from the beginning
examples: They were attracted to each other from the first.

meanings.def: from beginning to end; during the whole time
examples: It's a fine performance that commands attention from first to last.

idioms.def: the person or thing with the highest status in a group
examples: He was regarded as the ‘first among equals’ by the other office clerks.
They were attracted to each other from the first.

idioms.def: from beginning to end; during the whole time
examples: It's a fine performance that commands attention from first to last.
